Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Mono.Android-Tests] Use new internalx TLS test servers" (#1477) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: A recent certificate expiration on the old 'xamdev' test servers caused a number of failures in existing tests. We have since stood up new test servers which can be used instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Xamarin Firebase Unregistered token" (#1460) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Install the Xamarin Firebase Messaging NuGet package and set up everything
2. Go to Firebase console and send a test message to a device associated with a token
3. Message does not get delivered and Firebase console complains that the token is unregistered

Not sure if this is the right place to report the bug.

Anyhow, I ended up getting this to work by adding this to the manifest:

```
    <uses-permission android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.RECEIVE" />
    <receiver
    android:name="com.google.firebase.iid.FirebaseInstanceIdReceiver"
    android:exported="true"
    android:permission="com.google.android.c2dm.permission.SEND" >
      <intent-filter>
        <action android:name="com.google.android.c2dm.intent.RECEIVE" />

        <category android:name="com.myapp.foo" />
      </intent-filter>
    </receiver>
    <receiver
    android:name="com.google.firebase.iid.FirebaseInstanceIdInternalReceiver"
    android:exported="false" />
```

This is what Android Studio adds when adding Firebase from there.

Don't see this mentioned in any guide. Just recently started having issues with Firebase in a new app.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Mono.Android-Tests] Use new internalx TLS test servers" (#1476) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: A recent certificate expiration on the old 'xamdev' test servers caused a number of failures in existing tests. We temporarily switched over to httpbin (see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/commit/de392363) when this happened, but we have since stood up new test servers which can be used instead.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "[tests] fix failing NetStandardReferenceTest on Windows" (#1470) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/index?buildId=1515010&tab=ms.vss-test-web.test-result-details

Since f7c942d, the NUnit tests have been failing on Windows. The
`NetStandardReferenceTest` is looking for `System.IO.Compression.dll`
inside the APK, but it is not there.

Looking into it, I don't see anything that explicitly needs
`System.IO.Compression.dll`, so perhaps we really don't need to assert
that this file exists.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Fix an issue where the 'ref' nuget is not found on windows." (#1474) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
The previous commit 029a8b49 fixed up some issues with resolving
the correct nuget. However on windows we get some weird pathing
issues because the project.assets.json file is using `/` as
path seperators. This is probably to be platform independent.
But our string comparision was using what ever path we had, on
windows that was `\`. So we never found the Library were we
looking for. We also need to normalize the resulting full path
to match the system path separator.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Xamarin Forms Application Doesn't Startup After Changing The Date to a Past Date" (#2194) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Whenever I set the date to a past date (for debugging and testing purposes), the Xamarin App doesn't startup. It is repllicable even in a freshly created new Xamarin Forms application. I used it to replicate this issue.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Open the app to verify that it is working.
2. Close the app completely.
3. Go to phone's setting and set the date to a past date.
4. Reopen the app.

### Expected Behavior
The app starts up successfully and it shows the main page.

### Actual Behavior
The app doesn't startup and is stack on the blank loading screen.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:

- Platform Target Frameworks: Android
 - Android: Android SDK 8.1 Oreo
- Android Support Library Version: 25.4.0.2 and 
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy S6, Samsung Galaxy S7 Edge, Samsung Galaxy S8

### Description
The main XAML based Microsoft technologies such as Silverlight, WPF, and UWP have a class called CollectionViewSource.  Xamarin Forms does not. The INotifyCollectionChanged interface is a very important interface between models and the user interface. The interface enables the UI to refresh without completely clearing the elements of a list of items and rebuilding those elements from scratch every time an item is added or removed. This improves performance and responsiveness.

CollectionViewSource is aimed at providing a common implementation of INotifyCollectionChanged across technologies, and also at providing common filtering and sorting functionality across controls via the INotifyCollectionChanged interface. When CollectionViewSource is not available, a control must implement filtering and sorting by itself which is more or less a hack. For example, ListView has this property (https://developer.xamarin.com/api/property/System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Sorting/). 

CollectionViewSource providers a layer of abstraction for filtering, grouping and sorting so that any control that implements does not need to re-implement the functionality that already exists in the CollectionViewSource class. It also means that filtering and sorting can be applied at a level that does not affect the model. For example, if the sorting of a given list may cause some side affect if the underlying model is changed, sorting can still be achieved with CollectionViewSource because CollectionViewSource does not change the underlying model.

Many of the controls in the XF toolkit like ListView and Picker and so on will probably need to implement the functionality in some way. The most common use for the class on other platforms was for DataGrids but this does not exist in the standard XF toolkit. However, 3rd party controls like the SyncFusion DataGrid could be brought in to line with the standard Microsoft standards if those standards existed for Xamarin Forms.

MSDN Article
https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.data.collectionviewsource(v=vs.110).aspx

WPF Samples
https://github.com/Microsoft/WPF-Samples/tree/master/Data%20Binding/CollectionViewSource

An article:
https://www.hanselman.com/blog/CollectionViewSourceIsCrazyUsefulForBindingToFilteredObservableCollectionsOnWindowsPhone8.aspx

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "FadeTo(double opacity, uint length) does not work" (#2179) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I don't remember version where all worked good but I remember date. It was at November of last year.
I've noticed this for Android and have not checked this for iOS

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create button
2. Create some event and handler to it
3. In this handler write this code

```
_butAdd.FadeTo(0, 300);
Task.Delay(300).Wait();
_butAdd.IsVisible = false;
```
or
```
 _butAdd.FadeTo(1, 300);
 _butAdd.IsVisible = true;
 Task.Delay(300).Wait();
```
### Expected Behavior
Button must achieve or bunk slowly
### Actual Behavior
But it achieves or bunk instantly
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  not checked
  - Android: some
  - UWP:  not checked

- Nuget Packages: Last stable
- Affected Devices: Visual Studio emulator and real Huawei Honor 8 Lite

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Android] TapGestureRecognizer do not respond consistently to taps" (#1374) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
On Android the TapGestureRegenisor do not consistently fire the tapped event.

### Steps to Reproduce

Tap on any xamarin forms control (except button) 

### Expected Behavior
gesture event should be fired

### Actual Behavior
most  of times the gesture is not fired

### Basic Information

This is a known bug, but with importance normal.
https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=60893#c1

## **We have an application that is about to get to production next month and we must solve this.**

Thanks,

Ady.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Custom Controls 2-way binding doesn't work (Xamarin.Froms.WPF)" (#2190) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Custom Controls 2-way binding doesn't work (Xamarin.Froms.WPF). Works only for getting the value (not writing it back)

### Steps to Reproduce
Create a custom control in the Xamarin.Forms project with bindable property. Add the custom control to a view that uses it and bind custom property with TwoWay binding. Run the WPF project that include the new custom control

### Expected Behavior
2-way binding should work (read/write)
### Actual Behavior
it only binds the Get not the Set

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: current nightly build of (Jul 2017) Xamarin.Forms.WPF
- Last known good version:
- IDE: VS2017
- Platform Target Frameworks: \
    - Xamarin.Froms.WPF
- Affected Devices:
    - Windows Devices

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Neverending build on device (due to Mac Agent disconnecting?)" (#3818) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Ok, this is driving my crazy, iPhone device build stopped working **at all**.

When I try to build my Xamarin.iOS project in the latest Visual Studio in iPhone-device configuration, it never finishes building - does not fail, does not succeed, just keeps building.  

The problem might be that I am getting those logs in Xamarin output, it repeats every few minutes:

> Connection to '192.168.15.128' completed successfully
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is not connected...
> Starting registered Agents: Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Agent Build 4.9.0.752...
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is running
> Build 4.9.0.752 started
> Starting registered Agents: ...
> The Agents have been started successfully
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is not connected...
> Starting registered Agents: Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Agent Build 4.9.0.752...
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is running
> Build 4.9.0.752 started
> Starting registered Agents: ...
> The Agents have been started successfully
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is not connected...
> Starting registered Agents: Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Build 4.9.0.752...
> Starting Agent Build 4.9.0.752...
> Agent Build 4.9.0.752 is running
> Build 4.9.0.752 started
> Starting registered Agents: ...
> The Agents have been started successfully

When I do iPhone Simulator build, it takes 1-3 minutes, succeeds and deploys OK.

But even when building for the simulator, I sometimes (like every 20 minutes I guess) get to situation when after successful build, I am presented with the Mac Agent connection dialog, where my Mac has the 'connected' icon, but when I close the dialog, I get some popup alert that active connection is needed - so what I need to do is Disconnect and Connect again in order to be able to deploy to the simulator.
This little issue is happening a few weeks, it is present since a few releases back. **But the neverending-build issue is only happening since I updated VS to 15.6.4** (but I have skipped a few releases between, like 15.6.2 and 3 I guess, so it might not be related exactly to 15.6.4).

Please also note that I have tried changing many of the properties in iOS project settings, tried rebooting windows, rebooting OS X, rebooting iPhone... basically spend whole day trying to make it work. And sometimes it actually did build (like 3 times during the whole day I guess), but there were erros with deploying (I was trying on iPhone 4 iOS 7, which used to work, like kAMDIncorrectArchitectureError). Then again the next builds were failing.
Also once in the million neverending tries, the build actually failed with error `Invalid bitcode signature`.

### Environment

OS X 10.13.3 inside VMware 14.1.1, XCode 9.2

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.6.4
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.6.4+27428.2015
Microsoft .NET Framework

### Build Logs
Intellisense output:

> [Failure] Could not find file 'D:\Dokumenty-D\aplikace\MyApp\MyApp.iOS\obj\iPhone\Debug\TemporaryGeneratedFile_E7A71F73-0F8D-4B9B-B56E-8E70B10BC5D3.cs'.

Guys, please fix Xamarin!

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Merge d15-6 SR3 into xcode9.3" (#3816) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Closed issue "Cannot find registrar.m" (#3201) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Existing Xamarin Forms project. Upgrade to latest Visual studio code. 
To Be honest there is not much in the repro path. This started to happen right after I upgraded to latest Xcode and Latest Xamarin update from stable channel. 
2. Archive for publishing/Debugging/running 

### Expected Behavior
Build/run the app without any issues. 
### Actual Behavior
Error in building. Please file a report at Xamarin bugzilaa
### Environment

1.
Visual Studio: Help > About Microsoft Visual Studio > Copy Info [button]
